New Records: England secured a 3-0 victory over Bosnia and Herzegovina in their European Championship preparation match on June 3, 2024.
Key Match Events: Goals scored by Cole Palmer in the 60th minute via a penalty.
Trent Alexander-Arnold scored in the 85th minute with a left-foot shot.
Harry Kane netted the final goal in the 89th minute.
Pre-Game Insights: Laurens criticized Southgate's decision to exclude players from the Euro 2024 squad.
Post-Match Reflections: England manager Gareth Southgate praised the team's performance and focus.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at St. James' Park in Newcastle-upon-Tyne, England.
